channel.title: Multiple acc help
channel.description: Ok I always thought about how to make this. I know what I have to do with declare players, but how do you make them switch and stuff? Something to do with NextPlayer()? Can someone walk me through this please. ~jR

item.title: Multiple acc help
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

No problem, glad I could help.

Read full topic

Wow, way to be quick lol. Thanks alot guys I learned so much today.

item.title: Multiple acc help
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Yup. NextPlayer does all of the logging in for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple acc help
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

Oh so .Banked is how many it has currently done.
So when LoadsToDo is devided(mod) by .Banked or when .Banked is mod by LoadsToDo, it will come up as zero meaning the player is done.
Got it.
But I dont understand one thing, after his mod LoadsToDo=0 its just a NextPlayer(True);
Will that 1 procedure log out the player and log in another one?

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple acc help
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

I think that was just an example, mod means the remainder after the first number is divided by the second number, which in this case, if, say MaxLoadsPlayer is = to 10, and Players[CurrentPlayer].Banked ( Number of loads done ) is also = to 10, then the remainder of (10 / 10) = 0, which means that this player is done, so it switches to the next.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple acc help
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

Okay I think I udnerstand this now. When you put NextPlayer(False) that player wont be used again to auto, and when you put NextPlayer(True) , that player will stay active meaning he can be logged into again and then it will logg onto the next player.

Nice, and one more thing
(Players[CurrentPlayer].Banked mod MaxLoadsPlayer = 0)
That has something to do with the current player being used at the moment in the script, but what does the .Banked and mod mean?
And Why is MaxLoadsPlayer = 0?
Doesnâ€™t it have to be a certain integer and then it switches players?
Like you said before
"const MaxLoadsPlayer:=3; "

Thanks for the help.
~jR

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple acc help
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

This is why you load every procedure in your script with if not LoggedIn then Exit;

Than at the end of the script, if somehow the player messed up and got logged out you can put this:
if not LoggedIn then NextPlayer(False);

This will log in the next player who has a True Active status, at the same time it will set the player you are Currently using to False, so he will not be used again. If you want the player to keep going, because he is successful, and wants to continue on, use something like this:

[scar]const MaxLoadsPlayer:=3; //Loads before switching players.

if ((LoggedIn) and (Players[CurrentPlayer].Banked mod MaxLoadsPlayer = 0)) then
NextPlayer(True);[/scar]
That will make the current player stay active, while switching to the next active player.

Read full topic
